sentences.english: It is an odd thing to have happened to me, but it is what it is. I have become obsessed with sewing.
sentences.chinese: 我感到十分古怪，但就是这样，我已经为缝纫而痴迷。
小强痴迷于玩电脑游戏。

sentences.english: Because I thought it was cool, since I am into technology and other geeky things.
sentences.chinese: 由于我痴迷科技和极客的东西，我认为它很酷。

sentences.english: For thous_ands of years, man has been drawn to the Nile, known as "the Mt. Everest of rivers."
sentences.chinese: 数千年来，人类一直都为尼罗河而深深吸引和痴迷。

sentences.english: All of these sayings reflect the American obsession with properness and efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些格言都反映了美国人对正派和效率的痴迷。

sentences.english: They make the women all over the world swooned.
sentences.chinese: 他们让全世界的女人痴迷。

sentences.english: Second, the literati painters regardless of the pros and cons of honor, always obsessed with painting.
sentences.chinese: 其二，文人画家不管荣辱得失，始终痴迷于绘事。

sentences.english: I supinely begin look goes against beautiful scene, unconsciously infatuateds.
sentences.chinese: 我仰起头看着顶上的美景，不觉痴迷。

sentences.english: You and the "nuked Japan" obsession again.
sentences.chinese: 你和痴迷“核平日本”的论调又来了。

sentences.english: For a population obsessed with becoming ultra-thin, sensors seem to be reflecting the fashion trend.
sentences.chinese: 对于痴迷成为超薄人口，传感器似乎反映时尚潮流。

sentences.english: Some hedge funds remain dazzled by gold.
sentences.chinese: 些对冲基金仍然痴迷于黄金。

sentences.english: The dot-com boom was built on infatuation with anything Web-related.
sentences.chinese: 网络泡沫就建立在对所有网络有关的东西的痴迷之上。

sentences.english: When I got acce again it didn't have the same a eal any more.
sentences.chinese: 当我重新回到网上时，不再有原来那种痴迷了。

sentences.english: Happy smile, full of obsession with the cause.
sentences.chinese: 幸福的笑靥，盛满了对事业的痴迷。

sentences.english: No number nine love potion could make me love her more.
sentences.chinese: 九号爱情灵药也不会令我对她更加痴迷。

sentences.english: As geeks and nerds, we’re super-excited by touch.
sentences.chinese: 作为电脑狂人和达人，我们对触摸技术都非常痴迷。

definition: to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to be keen on/to have a passion for
to have a special fondness (for sth)
to be strongly attached to/to be dedicated/to cling to
to become excited with/to be enchanted by
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
